channel.title: Screenshot Tool
channel.description:
This is a tool I made recently that can automatically save your screen shot's each time you take one. This has a different hot key instead of Print Screen in case you want to leave your Print Screen key to non auto-saving screen shots or what not. The hot key is F12, simply anytime you want to take a screen shot, press F12 on your keyboard and it will automatically input it into the program for display and save it to a folder in your pictures.
You can download it here: http://www.mediafire.com/?mbbdadlbxqd8uhx
And here is a picture:
[IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/2hd1cug.png[/img]
There are also more features in it which I will leave for you to figure out when you use it.
Please tell me about any bugs or problems within the program, as it has not been fully tested yet. *Note, the image preview function when you double click the picture seems to only work with .png images, so you may have an issue with that!

item.title: Screenshot Tool
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

m.dog311:

I’m sorry, but what about this is better than the Print Screen button on my keyboard?

It is better because you get the satisfaction of actually having to open the program (thus making you minimize your current programs) and click a button. To me, well I would just say its a very user-friendly program.

Read full topic

item.title: Screenshot Tool
item.dc:creator: @JKOK JKOK
item.description:
@JKOK wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:6, topic:367567”][quote author=RuneSpace link=topic=463719.msg3392527#msg3392527 date=1289075255]

Somebody scan this please

If its safe i will use

Its clean.

Show a pic of scan plz
I dont trust stuff posted by low reppers
[/quote]

Rep has become a meaningless number, but if you don’t want to take my word for it:

http://virusscan.jotti.org/en/scanresult/d112c427f644ffb22e96e5d8f9f92cc2c1267ee0[/quote]

i know it looks good but i have dled some stuff on this forum and scanned “clean” is what all my virus scans for it says but in the file but havent tested on this tho but…

(C:\Users\jkok\AppData\Local\Temp\jarcache.*******************.tmp)
i have found trojan downloaders keyloggers and trojabs itself on some files so what i do everyday i dl i do

(starttab)
(search)
("%temp%)
(delete all fiels thagt say “jarcache”)
(enjoy my trojan free days)

because thos jarcaches are whats left after u download the files and would also hide deadly .class files like some the following
“crime.class” (trojan downloader)
“keygen.class” (keylogger)
“viewer.class” (privacy viewer(passwords usernames etc.))
and so on so beware not all virus scanners do all u think of :S

Read full topic

item.title: Screenshot Tool
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“bsk8r, post:10, topic:367567”]You can use this while its minimized, it doesn’t need to be up.

All you do is press F12 anytime you want to take a screenshot and it will automatically save your picture.
There is also other features in there that you can see when you use it, such as it keeps a history of your previously saved/viewed photos that you can reopen or delete.

It is mainly just for quickly taking and saving for later use or to open up and resize later, instead of having to go back and forth from paint.[/quote]
So, this has the potential to be a keylogger then? I’ll decompile it and check on that

Read full topic

item.title: Screenshot Tool
item.dc:creator: @bsk8r bsk8r
item.description:
@bsk8r wrote:

You can use this while its minimized, it doesn’t need to be up.

All you do is press F12 anytime you want to take a screenshot and it will automatically save your picture.
There is also other features in there that you can see when you use it, such as it keeps a history of your previously saved/viewed photos that you can reopen or delete.

It is mainly just for quickly taking and saving for later use or to open up and resize later, instead of having to go back and forth from paint.

Read full topic
